questions.text: Which of the following statements is not true about male sexual development?

options.label: A
options.text: At eight weeks the embryo is bipotent

options.label: B
options.text: Wolffian duct develops into epididymis and vas deferens on either side of the body

options.label: C
options.text: Mullerian inhibiting substance inhibits mullerian duct

options.label: D
options.text: Dihydrotestosterone leads to the development of secondary sexual characters and external genitalia

questions.correct_answer: A. At eight weeks the embryo is bipotent
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) At eight weeks the embryo is bipotent

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • At eight weeks of gestation, the embryo is no longer bipotent. The term "bipotent" refers to the embryo's capability to develop into either male or female structures, which is true up until about the sixth week of development. By the eighth week, sexual differentiation is already underway, with the influence of the SRY gene causing the gonads to differentiate into testes in 46XY embryos. This differentiation results in a shift away from bipotency, making the embryo committed to developing male characteristics.
  • • Other options:
  • • Other options:
  • • Option B. Wolffian duct develops into epididymis and vas deferens on either side of the body : This statement is true. The Wolffian ducts, under the influence of testosterone, develop into the male reproductive structures including the epididymis and vas deferens.
  • • Option B. Wolffian duct develops into epididymis and vas deferens on either side of the body
  • • Option C. Mullerian inhibiting substance inhibits Mullerian duct : This statement is true. Mullerian inhibiting substance (MIS), also known as anti-Mullerian hormone (AMH), is produced by Sertoli cells in the testes and inhibits the development of the Mullerian ducts, which would otherwise develop into female reproductive structures such as the uterine tubes and uterus.
  • • Option C. Mullerian inhibiting substance inhibits Mullerian duct
  • • Option D. Dihydrotestosterone leads to the development of secondary sexual characters and external genitalia : This statement is true. Dihydrotestosterone (DHT), a potent metabolite of testosterone, is crucial for the development of male external genitalia and secondary sexual characteristics such as facial hair and a deeper voice.
  • • Option D. Dihydrotestosterone leads to the development of secondary sexual characters and external genitalia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ At eight weeks of gestation, the embryo is no longer bipotent; sexual differentiation has already commenced.

The anterior division primarily provides motor branches to the muscles of mastication, with the exception of the buccal nerve, which is sensory.

questions.text: A 30-year-old pregnant woman in her third trimester presents for a routine checkup. Which of the following changes is not observed in a normal pregnancy?

Educational Objective:

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding chest trauma are true? ECG should be performed in all cases with associated sternal fracture Underwater seal drainage is indicated if pneumothorax is present Diaphragmatic rupture is best diagnosed by surgical exploration Urgent surgery is required in all cases of massive hemothorax Sternal fractures are markers of possible associated internal injuries
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Chest trauma evaluation begins with clinical assessment, followed by imaging such as chest X-ray. ECG is essential in suspected cardiac involvement, especially with sternal fractures. Not all cases require surgical intervention; conservative management is often sufficient depending on associated injuries.
  • ➤ Chest trauma evaluation begins with clinical assessment, followed by imaging such as chest X-ray.
  • ➤ ECG is essential in suspected cardiac involvement, especially with sternal fractures.
  • ➤ Not all cases require surgical intervention; conservative management is often sufficient depending on associated injuries.

questions.text: A 29-year-old woman presents with a racing heartbeat occurring intermittently for 6 months. She has a history of thyrotoxicosis, managed with propranolol and carbimazole. Investigations: ECG – shown below: Which is the most likely diagnosis?

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Wolff-Parkinson-White syndrome is an accessory pathway disorder characterized by a short PR interval, delta waves, and broad QRS complexes.

Which of the following is most likely to be dysfunctional in this patient?

questions.correct_answer: C. Buffered charcoal yeast extract (BCYE) agar

questions.text: A 63-year woman old presents to the AIIMS emergency chest pain after an RTA. Which resulted in crushed left lower limb. ECG shows 1-2 mm ST elevations in leads V2-V4 & troponin are elevated. The patient undergoes CAG which was normal. Which of the following is likely?

options.label: B
options.text: Apical hyperkinesis with free wall akinesia

options.label: C
options.text: Severe mitral regurgitation with papillary muscle dysfunction

questions.correct_answer: D. Akinetic LV apex with ballooning
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Akinetic LV apex with ballooning
